1.verse: John Prepares for Jesus - This is the beginning of the Good News about Jesus Christ, the Son of God,

2.verse: as the prophet Isaiah wrote: “I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way.” Malachi 3:1

3.verse: “This is a voice of one who calls out in the desert: ‘Prepare the way for the Lord. Make the road straight for him.’” Isaiah 40:3

4.verse: John was baptizing people in the desert and preaching a baptism of changed hearts and lives for the forgiveness of sins.

5.verse: All the people from Judea and Jerusalem were going out to him. They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

6.verse: John wore clothes made from camel’s hair, had a leather belt around his waist, and ate locusts and wild honey.

7.verse: This is what John preached to the people: “There is one coming after me who is greater than I; I am not good enough even to kneel down and untie his sandals.

8.verse: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”

9.verse: Jesus Is Baptized - At that time Jesus came from the town of Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan River.

10.verse: Immediately, as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven open. The Holy Spirit came down on him like a dove,

11.verse: and a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with you.”

12.verse: Then the Spirit sent Jesus into the desert.

13.verse: He was in the desert forty days and was tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and the angels came and took care of him.

14.verse: Jesus Chooses Some Followers - After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, preaching the Good News from God.

15.verse: He said, “The right time has come. The kingdom of God is near. Change your hearts and lives and believe the Good News!”

16.verse: When Jesus was walking by Lake Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the lake because they were fishermen.

17.verse: Jesus said to them, “Come follow me, and I will make you fish for people.”

18.verse: So Simon and Andrew immediately left their nets and followed him.

19.verse: Going a little farther, Jesus saw two more brothers, James and John, the sons of Zebedee. They were in a boat, mending their nets.

20.verse: Jesus immediately called them, and they left their father in the boat with the hired workers and followed Jesus.

21.verse: Jesus Forces Out an Evil Spirit - Jesus and his followers went to Capernaum. On the Sabbath day He went to the synagogue and began to teach.

22.verse: The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught like a person who had authority, not like their teachers of the law.

23.verse: Just then, a man was there in the synagogue who had an evil spirit in him. He shouted,

24.verse: “Jesus of Nazareth! What do you want with us? Did you come to destroy us? I know who you are—God’s Holy One!”

25.verse: Jesus commanded the evil spirit, “Be quiet! Come out of the man!”

26.verse: The evil spirit shook the man violently, gave a loud cry, and then came out of him.

27.verse: The people were so amazed they asked each other, “What is happening here? This man is teaching something new, and with authority. He even gives commands to evil spirits, and they obey him.”

28.verse: And the news about Jesus spread quickly everywhere in the area of Galilee.

29.verse: Jesus Heals Many People - As soon as Jesus and his followers left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.

30.verse: Simon’s mother-in-law was sick in bed with a fever, and the people told Jesus about her.

31.verse: So Jesus went to her bed, took her hand, and helped her up. The fever left her, and she began serving them.

32.verse: That evening, after the sun went down, the people brought to Jesus all who were sick and had demons in them.

33.verse: The whole town gathered at the door.

34.verse: Jesus healed many who had different kinds of sicknesses, and he forced many demons to leave people. But he would not allow the demons to speak, because they knew who he was.

35.verse: Early the next morning, while it was still dark, Jesus woke and left the house. He went to a lonely place, where he prayed.

36.verse: Simon and his friends went to look for Jesus.

37.verse: When they found him, they said, “Everyone is looking for you!”

38.verse: Jesus answered, “We should go to other towns around here so I can preach there too. That is the reason I came.”

39.verse: So he went everywhere in Galilee, preaching in the synagogues and forcing out demons.

40.verse: Jesus Heals a Sick Man - A man with a skin disease came to Jesus. He fell to his knees and begged Jesus, “You can heal me if you will.”

41.verse: Jesus felt sorry for the man, so he reached out his hand and touched him and said, “I will. Be healed!”

42.verse: Immediately the disease left the man, and he was healed.

43.verse: Jesus told the man to go away at once, but he warned him strongly,

44.verse: “Don’t tell anyone about this. But go and show yourself to the priest. And offer the gift Moses commanded for people who are made well. This will show the people what I have done.”

45.verse: The man left there, but he began to tell everyone that Jesus had healed him, and so he spread the news about Jesus. As a result, Jesus could not enter a town if people saw him. He stayed in places where nobody lived, but people came to him from everywhere.

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Paralyzed Man - A few days later, when Jesus came back to Capernaum, the news spread that he was at home.

2.verse: Many people gathered together so that there was no room in the house, not even outside the door. And Jesus was teaching them God’s message.

3.verse: Four people came, carrying a paralyzed man.

4.verse: Since they could not get to Jesus because of the crowd, they dug a hole in the roof right above where he was speaking. When they got through, they lowered the mat with the paralyzed man on it.

5.verse: When Jesus saw the faith of these people, he said to the paralyzed man, “Young man, your sins are forgiven.”

6.verse: Some of the teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,

7.verse: “Why does this man say things like that? He is speaking as if he were God. Only God can forgive sins.”

8.verse: Jesus knew immediately what these teachers of the law were thinking. So he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?

9.verse: Which is easier: to tell this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to tell him, ‘Stand up. Take your mat and walk’?

10.verse: But I will prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So Jesus said to the paralyzed man,

11.verse: “I tell you, stand up, take your mat, and go home.”

12.verse: Immediately the paralyzed man stood up, took his mat, and walked out while everyone was watching him. The people were amazed and praised God. They said, “We have never seen anything like this!”

13.verse: Jesus went to the lake again. The whole crowd followed him there, and he taught them.

14.verse: While he was walking along, he saw a man named Levi son of Alphaeus, sitting in the tax collector’s booth. Jesus said to him, “Follow me,” and he stood up and followed Jesus.

15.verse: Later, as Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and “sinners” were eating there with Jesus and his followers. Many people like this followed Jesus.

16.verse: When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw Jesus eating with the tax collectors and “sinners,” they asked his followers, “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

17.verse: Jesus heard this and said to them, “It is not the healthy people who need a doctor, but the sick. I did not come to invite good people but to invite sinners.”

18.verse: Jesus’ Followers Are Criticized - Now the followers of John and the Pharisees often fasted for a certain time. Some people came to Jesus and said, “Why do John’s followers and the followers of the Pharisees often fast, but your followers don’t?”

19.verse: Jesus answered, “The friends of the bridegroom do not fast while the bridegroom is still with them. As long as the bridegroom is with them, they cannot fast.

20.verse: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast.

21.verse: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth over a hole in an old coat. Otherwise, the patch will shrink and pull away—the new patch will pull away from the old coat. Then the hole will be worse.

22.verse: Also, no one ever pours new wine into old leather bags. Otherwise, the new wine will break the bags, and the wine will be ruined along with the bags. But new wine should be put into new leather bags.”

23.verse: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath - One Sabbath day, as Jesus was walking through some fields of grain, his followers began to pick some grain to eat.

24.verse: The Pharisees said to Jesus, “Why are your followers doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”

25.verse: Jesus answered, “Have you never read what David did when he and those with him were hungry and needed food?

26.verse: During the time of Abiathar the high priest, David went into God’s house and ate the holy bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And David also gave some of the bread to those who were with him.”

27.verse: Then Jesus said to the Pharisees, “The Sabbath day was made to help people; they were not made to be ruled by the Sabbath day.

28.verse: So then, the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath day.”

1.verse: Jesus Heals a Man’s Hand - Another time when Jesus went into a synagogue, a man with a crippled hand was there.

2.verse: Some people watched Jesus closely to see if he would heal the man on the Sabbath day so they could accuse him.

3.verse: Jesus said to the man with the crippled hand, “Stand up here in the middle of everyone.”

4.verse: Then Jesus asked the people, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath day: to do good or to do evil, to save a life or to kill?” But they said nothing to answer him.

5.verse: Jesus was angry as he looked at the people, and he felt very sad because they were stubborn. Then he said to the man, “Hold out your hand.” The man held out his hand and it was healed.

6.verse: Then the Pharisees left and began making plans with the Herodians about a way to kill Jesus.

7.verse: Many People Follow Jesus - Jesus left with his followers for the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed him.

8.verse: Also many people came from Judea, from Jerusalem, from Idumea, from the lands across the Jordan River, and from the area of Tyre and Sidon. When they heard what Jesus was doing, many people came to him.

9.verse: When Jesus saw the crowds, he told his followers to get a boat ready for him to keep people from crowding against him.

10.verse: He had healed many people, so all the sick were pushing toward him to touch him.

11.verse: When evil spirits saw Jesus, they fell down before him and shouted, “You are the Son of God!”

12.verse: But Jesus strongly warned them not to tell who he was.

13.verse: Jesus Chooses His Twelve Apostles - Then Jesus went up on a mountain and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.

14.verse: Jesus chose twelve and called them apostles. He wanted them to be with him, and he wanted to send them out to preach

15.verse: and to have the authority to force demons out of people.

16.verse: These are the twelve men he chose: Simon (Jesus named him Peter),

17.verse: James and John, the sons of Zebedee (Jesus named them Boanerges, which means “Sons of Thunder”),

18.verse: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot,

19.verse: and Judas Iscariot, who later turned against Jesus.

20.verse: Some People Say Jesus Has a Devil - Then Jesus went home, but again a crowd gathered. There were so many people that Jesus and his followers could not eat.

21.verse: When his family heard this, they went to get him because they thought he was out of his mind.

22.verse: But the teachers of the law from Jerusalem were saying, “Beelzebul is living inside him! He uses power from the ruler of demons to force demons out of people.”

23.verse: So Jesus called the people together and taught them with stories. He said, “Satan will not force himself out of people.

24.verse: A kingdom that is divided cannot continue,

25.verse: and a family that is divided cannot continue.

26.verse: And if Satan is against himself and fights against his own people, he cannot continue; that is the end of Satan.

27.verse: No one can enter a strong person’s house and steal his things unless he first ties up the strong person. Then he can steal things from the house.

28.verse: I tell you the truth, all sins that people do and all the things people say against God can be forgiven.

29.verse: But anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; he is guilty of a sin that continues forever.”

30.verse: Jesus said this because the teachers of the law said that he had an evil spirit inside him.

31.verse: Jesus’ True Family - Then Jesus’ mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to tell him to come out.

32.verse: Many people were sitting around Jesus, and they said to him, “Your mother and brothers are waiting for you outside.”

33.verse: Jesus asked, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

34.verse: Then he looked at those sitting around him and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!

35.verse: My true brother and sister and mother are those who do what God wants.”

1.verse: A Story About Planting Seed - Again Jesus began teaching by the lake. A great crowd gathered around him, so he sat down in a boat near the shore. All the people stayed on the shore close to the water.

2.verse: Jesus taught them many things, using stories. He said,

3.verse: “Listen! A farmer went out to plant his seed.

4.verse: While he was planting, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and ate it up.

5.verse: Some seed fell on rocky ground where there wasn’t much dirt. That seed grew very fast, because the ground was not deep.

6.verse: But when the sun rose, the plants dried up because they did not have deep roots.

7.verse: Some other seed fell among thorny weeds, which grew and choked the good plants. So those plants did not produce a crop.

8.verse: Some other seed fell on good ground and began to grow. It got taller and produced a crop. Some plants made thirty times more, some made sixty times more, and some made a hundred times more.”

9.verse: Then Jesus said, “Let those with ears use them and listen!”

10.verse: Jesus Tells Why He Used Stories - Later, when Jesus was alone, the twelve apostles and others around him asked him about the stories.

11.verse: Jesus said, “You can know the secret about the kingdom of God. But to other people I tell everything by using stories

12.verse: so that: ‘They will look and look, but they will not learn. They will listen and listen, but they will not understand. If they did learn and understand, they would come back to me and be forgiven.’” Isaiah 6:9–10

13.verse: Jesus Explains the Seed Story - Then Jesus said to his followers, “Don’t you understand this story? If you don’t, how will you understand any story?

14.verse: The farmer is like a person who plants God’s message in people.

15.verse: Sometimes the teaching falls on the road. This is like the people who hear the teaching of God, but Satan quickly comes and takes away the teaching that was planted in them.

16.verse: Others are like the seed planted on rocky ground. They hear the teaching and quickly accept it with joy.

17.verse: But since they don’t allow the teaching to go deep into their lives, they keep it only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the teaching they accepted, they quickly give up.

18.verse: Others are like the seed planted among the thorny weeds. They hear the teaching,

19.verse: but the worries of this life, the temptation of wealth, and many other evil desires keep the teaching from growing and producing fruit in their lives.

20.verse: Others are like the seed planted in the good ground. They hear the teaching and accept it. Then they grow and produce fruit—sometimes thirty times more, sometimes sixty times more, and sometimes a hundred times more.”

21.verse: Use What You Have - Then Jesus said to them, “Do you hide a lamp under a bowl or under a bed? No! You put the lamp on a lampstand.

22.verse: Everything that is hidden will be made clear and every secret thing will be made known.

23.verse: Let those with ears use them and listen!

24.verse: “Think carefully about what you hear. The way you give to others is the way God will give to you, but God will give you even more.

25.verse: Those who have understanding will be given more. But those who do not have understanding, even what they have will be taken away from them.”

26.verse: Jesus Uses a Story About Seed - Then Jesus said, “The kingdom of God is like someone who plants seed in the ground.

27.verse: Night and day, whether the person is asleep or awake, the seed still grows, but the person does not know how it grows.

28.verse: By itself the earth produces grain. First the plant grows, then the head, and then all the grain in the head.

29.verse: When the grain is ready, the farmer cuts it, because this is the harvest time.”

30.verse: A Story About Mustard Seed - Then Jesus said, “How can I show you what the kingdom of God is like? What story can I use to explain it?

31.verse: The kingdom of God is like a mustard seed, the smallest seed you plant in the ground.

32.verse: But when planted, this seed grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants. It produces large branches, and the wild birds can make nests in its shade.”

33.verse: Jesus used many stories like these to teach the crowd God’s message—as much as they could understand.

34.verse: He always used stories to teach them. But when he and his followers were alone, Jesus explained everything to them.

35.verse: Jesus Calms a Storm - That evening, Jesus said to his followers, “Let’s go across the lake.”

36.verse: Leaving the crowd behind, they took him in the boat just as he was. There were also other boats with them.

37.verse: A very strong wind came up on the lake. The waves came over the sides and into the boat so that it was already full of water.

38.verse: Jesus was at the back of the boat, sleeping with his head on a cushion. His followers woke him and said, “Teacher, don’t you care that we are drowning!”

39.verse: Jesus stood up and commanded the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind stopped, and it became completely calm.

40.verse: Jesus said to his followers, “Why are you afraid? Do you still have no faith?”

41.verse: The followers were very afraid and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”

1.verse: A Man with Demons Inside Him - Jesus and his followers went to the other side of the lake to the area of the Gerasene people.

2.verse: When Jesus got out of the boat, instantly a man with an evil spirit came to him from the burial caves.

3.verse: This man lived in the caves, and no one could tie him up, not even with a chain.

4.verse: Many times people had used chains to tie the man’s hands and feet, but he always broke them off. No one was strong enough to control him.

5.verse: Day and night he would wander around the burial caves and on the hills, screaming and cutting himself with stones.

6.verse: While Jesus was still far away, the man saw him, ran to him, and fell down before him.

7.verse: The man shouted in a loud voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I command you in God’s name not to torture me!”

8.verse: He said this because Jesus was saying to him, “You evil spirit, come out of the man.”

9.verse: Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He answered, “My name is Legion, because we are many spirits.”

10.verse: He begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of that area.

11.verse: A large herd of pigs was feeding on a hill near there.

12.verse: The demons begged Jesus, “Send us into the pigs; let us go into them.”

13.verse: So Jesus allowed them to do this. The evil spirits left the man and went into the pigs. Then the herd of pigs—about two thousand of them—rushed down the hill into the lake and were drowned.

14.verse: The herdsmen ran away and went to the town and to the countryside, telling everyone about this. So people went out to see what had happened.

15.verse: They came to Jesus and saw the man who used to have the many evil spirits, sitting, clothed, and in his right mind. And they were frightened.

16.verse: The people who saw this told the others what had happened to the man who had the demons living in him, and they told about the pigs.

17.verse: Then the people began to beg Jesus to leave their area.

18.verse: As Jesus was getting back into the boat, the man who was freed from the demons begged to go with him.

19.verse: But Jesus would not let him. He said, “Go home to your family and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and how he has had mercy on you.”

20.verse: So the man left and began to tell the people in the Ten Towns about what Jesus had done for him. And everyone was amazed.

21.verse: Jesus Gives Life to a Dead Girl and Heals a Sick Woman - When Jesus went in the boat back to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him there.

22.verse: A leader of the synagogue, named Jairus, came there, saw Jesus, and fell at his feet.

23.verse: He begged Jesus, saying again and again, “My daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so she will be healed and will live.”

24.verse: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed Jesus and pushed very close around him.

25.verse: Among them was a woman who had been bleeding for twelve years.

26.verse: She had suffered very much from many doctors and had spent all the money she had, but instead of improving, she was getting worse.

27.verse: When the woman heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his coat.

28.verse: She thought, “If I can just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”

29.verse: Instantly her bleeding stopped, and she felt in her body that she was healed from her disease.

30.verse: At once Jesus felt power go out from him. So he turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”

31.verse: His followers said, “Look at how many people are pushing against you! And you ask, ‘Who touched me?’ ”

32.verse: But Jesus continued looking around to see who had touched him.

33.verse: The woman, knowing that she was healed, came and fell at Jesus’ feet. Shaking with fear, she told him the whole truth.

34.verse: Jesus said to her, “Dear woman, you are made well because you believed. Go in peace; be healed of your disease.”

35.verse: While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of the synagogue leader. They said, “Your daughter is dead. There is no need to bother the teacher anymore.”

36.verse: But Jesus paid no attention to what they said. He told the synagogue leader, “Don’t be afraid; just believe.”

37.verse: Jesus let only Peter, James, and John the brother of James go with him.

38.verse: When they came to the house of the synagogue leader, Jesus found many people there making lots of noise and crying loudly.

39.verse: Jesus entered the house and said to them, “Why are you crying and making so much noise? The child is not dead, only asleep.”

40.verse: But they laughed at him. So, after throwing them out of the house, Jesus took the child’s father and mother and his three followers into the room where the child was.

41.verse: Taking hold of the girl’s hand, he said to her, “Talitha, koum!” (This means, “Young girl, I tell you to stand up!”)

42.verse: At once the girl stood right up and began walking. (She was twelve years old.) Everyone was completely amazed.

43.verse: Jesus gave them strict orders not to tell people about this. Then he told them to give the girl something to eat.

1.verse: Jesus Goes to His Hometown - Jesus left there and went to his hometown, and his followers went with him.

2.verse: On the Sabbath day he taught in the synagogue. Many people heard him and were amazed, saying, “Where did this man get these teachings? What is this wisdom that has been given to him? And where did he get the power to do miracles?

3.verse: He is just the carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas, and Simon. And his sisters are here with us.” So the people were upset with Jesus.

4.verse: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is honored everywhere except in his hometown and with his own people and in his own home.”

5.verse: So Jesus was not able to work any miracles there except to heal a few sick people by putting his hands on them.

6.verse: He was amazed at how many people had no faith. Then Jesus went to other villages in that area and taught.

7.verse: He called his twelve followers together and got ready to send them out two by two and gave them authority over evil spirits.

8.verse: This is what Jesus commanded them: “Take nothing for your trip except a walking stick. Take no bread, no bag, and no money in your pockets.

9.verse: Wear sandals, but take only the clothes you are wearing.

10.verse: When you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.

11.verse: If the people in a certain place refuse to welcome you or listen to you, leave that place. Shake its dust off your feet as a warning to them.”

12.verse: So the followers went out and preached that people should change their hearts and lives.

13.verse: They forced many demons out and put olive oil on many sick people and healed them.

14.verse: How John the Baptist Was Killed - King Herod heard about Jesus, because he was now well known. Some people said, “He is John the Baptist, who has risen from the dead. That is why he can work these miracles.”

15.verse: Others said, “He is Elijah.” Other people said, “Jesus is a prophet, like the prophets who lived long ago.”

16.verse: When Herod heard this, he said, “I killed John by cutting off his head. Now he has risen from the dead!”

17.verse: Herod himself had ordered his soldiers to arrest John and put him in prison in order to please his wife, Herodias. She had been the wife of Philip, Herod’s brother, but then Herod had married her.

18.verse: John had been telling Herod, “It is not lawful for you to be married to your brother’s wife.”

19.verse: So Herodias hated John and wanted to kill him. But she couldn’t,

20.verse: because Herod was afraid of John and protected him. He knew John was a good and holy man. Also, though John’s preaching always bothered him, he enjoyed listening to John.

21.verse: Then the perfect time came for Herodias to cause John’s death. On Herod’s birthday, he gave a dinner party for the most important government leaders, the commanders of his army, and the most important people in Galilee.

22.verse: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and the people eating with him. So King Herod said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I will give it to you.”

23.verse: He promised her, “Anything you ask for I will give to you—up to half of my kingdom.”

24.verse: The girl went to her mother and asked, “What should I ask for?” Her mother answered, “Ask for the head of John the Baptist.”

25.verse: At once the girl went back to the king and said to him, “I want the head of John the Baptist right now on a platter.”

26.verse: Although the king was very sad, he had made a promise, and his dinner guests had heard it. So he did not want to refuse what she asked.

27.verse: Immediately the king sent a soldier to bring John’s head. The soldier went and cut off John’s head in the prison

28.verse: and brought it back on a platter. He gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to her mother.

29.verse: When John’s followers heard this, they came and got John’s body and put it in a tomb.

30.verse: More than Five Thousand Fed - The apostles gathered around Jesus and told him about all the things they had done and taught.

31.verse: Crowds of people were coming and going so that Jesus and his followers did not even have time to eat. He said to them, “Come away by yourselves, and we will go to a lonely place to get some rest.”

32.verse: So they went in a boat by themselves to a lonely place.

33.verse: But many people saw them leave and recognized them. So from all the towns they ran to the place where Jesus was going, and they got there before him.

34.verse: When he arrived, he saw a great crowd waiting. He felt sorry for them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began to teach them many things.

35.verse: When it was late in the day, his followers came to him and said, “No one lives in this place, and it is already very late.

36.verse: Send the people away so they can go to the countryside and towns around here to buy themselves something to eat.”

37.verse: But Jesus answered, “You give them something to eat.” They said to him, “We would all have to work a month to earn enough money to buy that much bread!”

38.verse: Jesus asked them, “How many loaves of bread do you have? Go and see.” When they found out, they said, “Five loaves and two fish.”

39.verse: Then Jesus told his followers to have the people sit in groups on the green grass.

40.verse: So they sat in groups of fifty or a hundred.

41.verse: Jesus took the five loaves and two fish and, looking up to heaven, he thanked God for the food. He divided the bread and gave it to his followers for them to give to the people. Then he divided the two fish among them all.

42.verse: All the people ate and were satisfied.

43.verse: The followers filled twelve baskets with the leftover pieces of bread and fish.

44.verse: There were five thousand men who ate.

45.verse: Jesus Walks on the Water - Immediately Jesus told his followers to get into the boat and go ahead of him to Bethsaida across the lake. He stayed there to send the people home.

46.verse: After sending them away, he went into the hills to pray.

47.verse: That night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and Jesus was alone on the land.

48.verse: He saw his followers struggling hard to row the boat, because the wind was blowing against them. Between three and six o’clock in the morning, Jesus came to them, walking on the water, and he wanted to walk past the boat.

49.verse: But when they saw him walking on the water, they thought he was a ghost and cried out.

50.verse: They all saw him and were afraid. But quickly Jesus spoke to them and said, “Have courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”

51.verse: Then he got into the boat with them, and the wind became calm. The followers were greatly amazed.

52.verse: They did not understand about the miracle of the five loaves, because their minds were closed.

53.verse: When they had crossed the lake, they came to shore at Gennesaret and tied the boat there.

54.verse: When they got out of the boat, people immediately recognized Jesus.

55.verse: They ran everywhere in that area and began to bring sick people on mats wherever they heard he was.

56.verse: And everywhere he went—into towns, cities, or countryside—the people brought the sick to the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch just the edge of his coat, and all who touched it were healed.

1.verse: Obey God’s Law - When some Pharisees and some teachers of the law came from Jerusalem, they gathered around Jesus.

2.verse: They saw that some of Jesus’ followers ate food with hands that were not clean, that is, they hadn’t washed them.

3.verse: (The Pharisees and all the Jews never eat before washing their hands in the way required by their unwritten laws.

4.verse: And when they buy something in the market, they never eat it until they wash themselves in a special way. They also follow many other unwritten laws, such as the washing of cups, pitchers, and pots.)

5.verse: The Pharisees and the teachers of the law said to Jesus, “Why don’t your followers obey the unwritten laws which have been handed down to us? Why do your followers eat their food with hands that are not clean?”

6.verse: Jesus answered, “Isaiah was right when he spoke about you hypocrites. He wrote, ‘These people show honor to me with words, but their hearts are far from me.

7.verse: Their worship of me is worthless. The things they teach are nothing but human rules.’ Isaiah 29:13

8.verse: You have stopped following the commands of God, and you follow only human teachings.”

9.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “You cleverly ignore the commands of God so you can follow your own teachings.

10.verse: Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and ‘Anyone who says cruel things to his father or mother must be put to death.’

11.verse: But you say a person can tell his father or mother, ‘I have something I could use to help you, but it is Corban—a gift to God.’

12.verse: You no longer let that person use that money for his father or his mother.

13.verse: By your own rules, which you teach people, you are rejecting what God said. And you do many things like that.”

14.verse: After Jesus called the crowd to him again, he said, “Every person should listen to me and understand what I am saying.

15.verse: There is nothing people put into their bodies that makes them unclean. People are made unclean by the things that come out of them. [

16.verse: Let those with ears use them and listen.]”

17.verse: When Jesus left the people and went into the house, his followers asked him about this story.

18.verse: Jesus said, “Do you still not understand? Surely you know that nothing that enters someone from the outside can make that person unclean.

19.verse: It does not go into the mind, but into the stomach. Then it goes out of the body.” (When Jesus said this, he meant that no longer was any food unclean for people to eat.)

20.verse: And Jesus said, “The things that come out of people are the things that make them unclean.

21.verse: All these evil things begin inside people, in the mind: evil thoughts, sexual sins, stealing, murder, adultery,

22.verse: greed, evil actions, lying, doing sinful things, jealousy, speaking evil of others, pride, and foolish living.

23.verse: All these evil things come from inside and make people unclean.”

24.verse: Jesus Helps a Non-Jewish Woman - Jesus left that place and went to the area around Tyre. When he went into a house, he did not want anyone to know he was there, but he could not stay hidden.

25.verse: A woman whose daughter had an evil spirit in her heard that he was there. So she quickly came to Jesus and fell at his feet.

26.verse: She was Greek, born in Phoenicia, in Syria. She begged Jesus to force the demon out of her daughter.

27.verse: Jesus told the woman, “It is not right to take the children’s bread and give it to the dogs. First let the children eat all they want.”

28.verse: But she answered, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table can eat the children’s crumbs.”

29.verse: Then Jesus said, “Because of your answer, you may go. The demon has left your daughter.”

30.verse: The woman went home and found her daughter lying in bed; the demon was gone.

31.verse: Jesus Heals a Deaf Man - Then Jesus left the area around Tyre and went through Sidon to Lake Galilee, to the area of the Ten Towns.

32.verse: While he was there, some people brought a man to him who was deaf and could not talk plainly. The people begged Jesus to put his hand on the man to heal him.

33.verse: Jesus led the man away from the crowd, by himself. He put his fingers in the man’s ears and then spit and touched the man’s tongue.

34.verse: Looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to the man, “Ephphatha!” (This means, “Be opened.”)

35.verse: Instantly the man was able to hear and to use his tongue so that he spoke clearly.

36.verse: Jesus commanded the people not to tell anyone about what happened. But the more he commanded them, the more they told about it.

37.verse: They were completely amazed and said, “Jesus does everything well. He makes the deaf hear! And those who can’t talk he makes able to speak.”

1.verse: More than Four Thousand People Fed - Another time there was a great crowd with Jesus that had nothing to eat. So Jesus called his followers and said,

2.verse: “I feel sorry for these people, because they have already been with me for three days, and they have nothing to eat.

3.verse: If I send them home hungry, they will faint on the way. Some of them live a long way from here.”

4.verse: Jesus’ followers answered, “How can we get enough bread to feed all these people? We are far away from any town.”

5.verse: Jesus asked, “How many loaves of bread do you have?” They answered, “Seven.”

6.verse: Jesus told the people to sit on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves, gave thanks to God, and divided the bread. He gave the pieces to his followers to give to the people, and they did so.

7.verse: The followers also had a few small fish. After Jesus gave thanks for the fish, he told his followers to give them to the people also.

8.verse: All the people ate and were satisfied. Then his followers filled seven baskets with the leftover pieces of food.

9.verse: There were about four thousand people who ate. After they had eaten, Jesus sent them home.

10.verse: Then right away he got into a boat with his followers and went to the area of Dalmanutha.

11.verse: The Leaders Ask for a Miracle - The Pharisees came to Jesus and began to ask him questions. Hoping to trap him, they asked Jesus for a miracle from God.

12.verse: Jesus sighed deeply and said, “Why do you people ask for a miracle as a sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to you.”

13.verse: Then Jesus left the Pharisees and went in the boat to the other side of the lake.

14.verse: Guard Against Wrong Teachings - His followers had only one loaf of bread with them in the boat; they had forgotten to bring more.

15.verse: Jesus warned them, “Be careful! Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

16.verse: His followers discussed the meaning of this, saying, “He said this because we have no bread.”

17.verse: Knowing what they were talking about, Jesus asked them, “Why are you talking about not having bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your minds closed?

18.verse: You have eyes, but you don’t really see. You have ears, but you don’t really listen. Remember when

19.verse: I divided five loaves of bread for the five thousand? How many baskets did you fill with leftover pieces of food?” They answered, “Twelve.”

20.verse: “And when I divided seven loaves of bread for the four thousand, how many baskets did you fill with leftover pieces of food?” They answered, “Seven.”

21.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t you understand yet?”

22.verse: Jesus Heals a Blind Man - Jesus and his followers came to Bethsaida. There some people brought a blind man to Jesus and begged him to touch the man.

23.verse: So Jesus took the blind man’s hand and led him out of the village. Then he spit on the man’s eyes and put his hands on the man and asked, “Can you see now?”

24.verse: The man looked up and said, “Yes, I see people, but they look like trees walking around.”

25.verse: Again Jesus put his hands on the man’s eyes. Then the man opened his eyes wide and they were healed, and he was able to see everything clearly.

26.verse: Jesus told him to go home, saying, “Don’t go into the town.”

27.verse: Peter Says Jesus Is the Christ - Jesus and his followers went to the towns around Caesarea Philippi. While they were traveling, Jesus asked them, “Who do people say I am?”

28.verse: They answered, “Some say you are John the Baptist. Others say you are Elijah, and others say you are one of the prophets.”

29.verse: Then Jesus asked, “But who do you say I am?” Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”

30.verse: Jesus warned his followers not to tell anyone who he was.

31.verse: Then Jesus began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and that he would be rejected by the Jewish elders, the leading priests, and the teachers of the law. He told them that the Son of Man must be killed and then rise from the dead after three days.

32.verse: Jesus told them plainly what would happen. Then Peter took Jesus aside and began to tell him not to talk like that.

33.verse: But Jesus turned and looked at his followers. Then he told Peter not to talk that way. He said, “Go away from me, Satan! You don’t care about the things of God, but only about things people think are important.”

34.verse: Then Jesus called the crowd to him, along with his followers. He said, “If people want to follow me, they must give up the things they want. They must be willing even to give up their lives to follow me.

35.verse: Those who want to save their lives will give up true life. But those who give up their lives for me and for the Good News will have true life.

36.verse: It is worthless to have the whole world if they lose their souls.

37.verse: They could never pay enough to buy back their souls.

38.verse: The people who live now are living in a sinful and evil time. If people are ashamed of me and my teaching, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes with his Father’s glory and with the holy angels.”

1.verse: Then Jesus said to the people, “I tell you the truth, some people standing here will see the kingdom of God come with power before they die.”

2.verse: Jesus Talks with Moses and Elijah - Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John up on a high mountain by themselves. While they watched, Jesus’ appearance was changed.

3.verse: His clothes became shining white, whiter than any person could make them.

4.verse: Then Elijah and Moses appeared to them, talking with Jesus.

5.verse: Peter said to Jesus, “Teacher, it is good that we are here. Let us make three tents—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

6.verse: Peter did not know what to say, because he and the others were so frightened.

7.verse: Then a cloud came and covered them, and a voice came from the cloud, saying, “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”

8.verse: Suddenly Peter, James, and John looked around, but they saw only Jesus there alone with them.

9.verse: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone about what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

10.verse: So the followers obeyed Jesus, but they discussed what he meant about rising from the dead.

11.verse: Then they asked Jesus, “Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”

12.verse: Jesus answered, “They are right to say that Elijah must come first and make everything the way it should be. But why does the Scripture say that the Son of Man will suffer much and that people will treat him as if he were nothing?

13.verse: I tell you that Elijah has already come. And people did to him whatever they wanted to do, just as the Scriptures said it would happen.”

14.verse: Jesus Heals a Sick Boy - When Jesus, Peter, James, and John came back to the other followers, they saw a great crowd around them and the teachers of the law arguing with them.

15.verse: But as soon as the crowd saw Jesus, the people were surprised and ran to welcome him.

16.verse: Jesus asked, “What are you arguing about?”

17.verse: A man answered, “Teacher, I brought my son to you. He has an evil spirit in him that stops him from talking.

18.verse: When the spirit attacks him, it throws him on the ground. Then my son foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes very stiff. I asked your followers to force the evil spirit out, but they couldn’t.”

19.verse: Jesus answered, “You people have no faith. How long must I stay with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”

20.verse: So the followers brought him to Jesus. As soon as the evil spirit saw Jesus, it made the boy lose control of himself, and he fell down and rolled on the ground, foaming at the mouth.

21.verse: Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has this been happening?” The father answered, “Since he was very young.

22.verse: The spirit often throws him into a fire or into water to kill him. If you can do anything for him, please have pity on us and help us.”

23.verse: Jesus said to the father, “You said, ‘If you can!’ All things are possible for the one who believes.”

24.verse: Immediately the father cried out, “I do believe! Help me to believe more!”

25.verse: When Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he ordered the evil spirit, saying, “You spirit that makes people unable to hear or speak, I command you to come out of this boy and never enter him again!”

26.verse: The evil spirit screamed and caused the boy to fall on the ground again. Then the spirit came out. The boy looked as if he were dead, and many people said, “He is dead!”

27.verse: But Jesus took hold of the boy’s hand and helped him to stand up.

28.verse: When Jesus went into the house, his followers began asking him privately, “Why couldn’t we force that evil spirit out?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, “That kind of spirit can only be forced out by prayer.”

30.verse: Jesus Talks About His Death - Then Jesus and his followers left that place and went through Galilee. He didn’t want anyone to know where he was,

31.verse: because he was teaching his followers. He said to them, “The Son of Man will be handed over to people, and they will kill him. After three days, he will rise from the dead.”

32.verse: But the followers did not understand what Jesus meant, and they were afraid to ask him.

33.verse: Who Is the Greatest? - Jesus and his followers went to Capernaum. When they went into a house there, he asked them, “What were you arguing about on the road?”

34.verse: But the followers did not answer, because their argument on the road was about which one of them was the greatest.

35.verse: Jesus sat down and called the twelve apostles to him. He said, “Whoever wants to be the most important must be last of all and servant of all.”

36.verse: Then Jesus took a small child and had him stand among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said,

37.verse: “Whoever accepts a child like this in my name accepts me. And whoever accepts me accepts the One who sent me.”

38.verse: Anyone Not Against Us Is for Us - Then John said, “Teacher, we saw someone using your name to force demons out of a person. We told him to stop, because he does not belong to our group.”

39.verse: But Jesus said, “Don’t stop him, because anyone who uses my name to do powerful things will not easily say evil things about me.

40.verse: Whoever is not against us is with us.

41.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever gives you a drink of water because you belong to the Christ will truly get his reward.

42.verse: “If one of these little children believes in me, and someone causes that child to sin, it would be better for that person to have a large stone tied around his neck and be drowned in the sea.

43.verse: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to lose part of your body and live forever than to have two hands and go to hell, where the fire never goes out. [

44.verse: In hell the worm does not die; the fire is never put out.]

45.verse: If your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to lose part of your body and to live forever than to have two feet and be thrown into hell. [

46.verse: In hell the worm does not die; the fire is never put out.]

47.verse: If your eye causes you to sin, take it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell.

48.verse: In hell the worm does not die; the fire is never put out.

49.verse: Every person will be salted with fire.

50.verse: “Salt is good, but if the salt loses its salty taste, you cannot make it salty again. So, be full of salt, and have peace with each other.”

1.verse: Jesus Teaches About Divorce - Then Jesus left that place and went into the area of Judea and across the Jordan River. Again, crowds came to him, and he taught them as he usually did.

2.verse: Some Pharisees came to Jesus and tried to trick him. They asked, “Is it right for a man to divorce his wife?”

3.verse: Jesus answered, “What did Moses command you to do?”

4.verse: They said, “Moses allowed a man to write out divorce papers and send her away.”

5.verse: Jesus said, “Moses wrote that command for you because you were stubborn.

6.verse: But when God made the world, ‘he made them male and female.’

7.verse: ‘So a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife,

8.verse: and the two will become one body.’ So there are not two, but one.

9.verse: God has joined the two together, so no one should separate them.”

10.verse: Later, in the house, his followers asked Jesus again about the question of divorce.

11.verse: He answered, “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman is guilty of adultery against her.

12.verse: And the woman who divorces her husband and marries another man is also guilty of adultery.”

13.verse: Jesus Accepts Children - Some people brought their little children to Jesus so he could touch them, but his followers told them to stop.

14.verse: When Jesus saw this, he was upset and said to them, “Let the little children come to me. Don’t stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people who are like these children.

15.verse: I tell you the truth, you must accept the kingdom of God as if you were a little child, or you will never enter it.”

16.verse: Then Jesus took the children in his arms, put his hands on them, and blessed them.

17.verse: A Rich Young Man’s Question - As Jesus started to leave, a man ran to him and fell on his knees before Jesus. The man asked, “Good teacher, what must I do to have life forever?”

18.verse: Jesus answered, “Why do you call me good? Only God is good.

19.verse: You know the commands: ‘You must not murder anyone. You must not be guilty of adultery. You must not steal. You must not tell lies about your neighbor. You must not cheat. Honor your father and mother.’”

20.verse: The man said, “Teacher, I have obeyed all these things since I was a boy.”

21.verse: Jesus, looking at the man, loved him and said, “There is one more thing you need to do. Go and sell everything you have, and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come and follow me.”

22.verse: He was very sad to hear Jesus say this, and he left sorrowfully, because he was rich.

23.verse: Then Jesus looked at his followers and said, “How hard it will be for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”

24.verse: The followers were amazed at what Jesus said. But he said again, “My children, it is very hard to enter the kingdom of God!

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: The followers were even more surprised and said to each other, “Then who can be saved?”

27.verse: Jesus looked at them and said, “For people this is impossible, but for God all things are possible.”

28.verse: Peter said to Jesus, “Look, we have left everything and followed you.”

29.verse: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, all those who have left houses, brothers, sisters, mother, father, children, or farms for me and for the Good News

30.verse: will get more than they left. Here in this world they will have a hundred times more homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields. And with those things, they will also suffer for their belief. But in this age they will have life forever.

31.verse: Many who are first now will be last in the future. And many who are last now will be first in the future.”

32.verse: Jesus Talks About His Death - As Jesus and the people with him were on the road to Jerusalem, he was leading the way. His followers were amazed, but others in the crowd who followed were afraid. Again Jesus took the twelve apostles aside and began to tell them what was about to happen in Jerusalem.

33.verse: He said, “Look, we are going to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be turned over to the leading priests and the teachers of the law. They will say that he must die, and they will turn him over to the non-Jewish people,

34.verse: who will laugh at him and spit on him. They will beat him with whips and crucify him. But on the third day, he will rise to life again.”

35.verse: Two Followers Ask Jesus a Favor - Then James and John, sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, “Teacher, we want to ask you to do something for us.”

36.verse: Jesus asked, “What do you want me to do for you?”

37.verse: They answered, “Let one of us sit at your right side and one of us sit at your left side in your glory in your kingdom.”

38.verse: Jesus said, “You don’t understand what you are asking. Can you drink the cup that I must drink? And can you be baptized with the same kind of baptism that I must go through?”

39.verse: They answered, “Yes, we can.” Jesus said to them, “You will drink the same cup that I will drink, and you will be baptized with the same baptism that I must go through.

40.verse: But I cannot choose who will sit at my right or my left; those places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”

41.verse: When the other ten followers heard this, they began to be angry with James and John.

42.verse: Jesus called them together and said, “The other nations have rulers. You know that those rulers love to show their power over the people, and their important leaders love to use all their authority.

43.verse: But it should not be that way among you. Whoever wants to become great among you must serve the rest of you like a servant.

44.verse: Whoever wants to become the first among you must serve all of you like a slave.

45.verse: In the same way, the Son of Man did not come to be served. He came to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many people.”

46.verse: Jesus Heals a Blind Man - Then they came to the town of Jericho. As Jesus was leaving there with his followers and a great many people, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus son of Timaeus was sitting by the road.

47.verse: When he heard that Jesus from Nazareth was walking by, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”

48.verse: Many people warned the blind man to be quiet, but he shouted even more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

49.verse: Jesus stopped and said, “Tell the man to come here.” So they called the blind man, saying, “Cheer up! Get to your feet. Jesus is calling you.”

50.verse: The blind man jumped up, left his coat there, and went to Jesus.

51.verse: Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man answered, “Teacher, I want to see.”

52.verse: Jesus said, “Go, you are healed because you believed.” At once the man could see, and he followed Jesus on the road.

1.verse: Jesus Enters Jerusalem as a King - As Jesus and his followers were coming closer to Jerusalem, they came to the towns of Bethphage and Bethany near the Mount of Olives. From there Jesus sent two of his followers

2.verse: and said to them, “Go to the town you can see there. When you enter it, you will quickly find a colt tied, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here to me.

3.verse: If anyone asks you why you are doing this, tell him its Master needs the colt, and he will send it at once.”

4.verse: The followers went into the town, found a colt tied in the street near the door of a house, and untied it.

5.verse: Some people were standing there and asked, “What are you doing? Why are you untying that colt?”

6.verse: The followers answered the way Jesus told them to answer, and the people let them take the colt.

7.verse: They brought the colt to Jesus and put their coats on it, and Jesus sat on it.

8.verse: Many people spread their coats on the road. Others cut branches in the fields and spread them on the road.

9.verse: The people were walking ahead of Jesus and behind him, shouting, “Praise God! God bless the One who comes in the name of the Lord! Psalm 118:26

10.verse: God bless the kingdom of our father David! That kingdom is coming! Praise to God in heaven!”

11.verse: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the Temple. After he had looked at everything, since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve apostles.

12.verse: The next day as Jesus was leaving Bethany, he became hungry.

13.verse: Seeing a fig tree in leaf from far away, he went to see if it had any figs on it. But he found no figs, only leaves, because it was not the right season for figs.

14.verse: So Jesus said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And Jesus’ followers heard him say this.

15.verse: Jesus Goes to the Temple - When Jesus returned to Jerusalem, he went into the Temple and began to throw out those who were buying and selling there. He turned over the tables of those who were exchanging different kinds of money, and he upset the benches of those who were selling doves.

16.verse: Jesus refused to allow anyone to carry goods through the Temple courts.

17.verse: Then he taught the people, saying, “It is written in the Scriptures, ‘My Temple will be called a house for prayer for people from all nations.’ But you are changing God’s house into a ‘hideout for robbers.’”

18.verse: The leading priests and the teachers of the law heard all this and began trying to find a way to kill Jesus. They were afraid of him, because all the people were amazed at his teaching.

19.verse: That evening, Jesus and his followers left the city.

20.verse: The Power of Faith - The next morning as Jesus was passing by with his followers, they saw the fig tree dry and dead, even to the roots.

21.verse: Peter remembered the tree and said to Jesus, “Teacher, look! The fig tree you cursed is dry and dead!”

23.verse: I tell you the truth, you can say to this mountain, ‘Go, fall into the sea.’ And if you have no doubts in your mind and believe that what you say will happen, God will do it for you.

24.verse: So I tell you to believe that you have received the things you ask for in prayer, and God will give them to you.

25.verse: When you are praying, if you are angry with someone, forgive him so that your Father in heaven will also forgive your sins. [

26.verse: But if you don’t forgive other people, then your Father in heaven will not forgive your sins.]”

27.verse: Leaders Doubt Jesus’ Authority - Jesus and his followers went again to Jerusalem. As Jesus was walking in the Temple, the leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders came to him.

28.verse: They said to him, “What authority do you have to do these things? Who gave you this authority?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, “I will ask you one question. If you answer me, I will tell you what authority I have to do these things.

30.verse: Tell me: When John baptized people, was that authority from God or just from other people?”

31.verse: They argued about Jesus’ question, saying, “If we answer, ‘John’s baptism was from God,’ Jesus will say, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’

32.verse: But if we say, ‘It was from other people,’ the crowd will be against us.” (These leaders were afraid of the people, because all the people believed that John was a prophet.)

33.verse: So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.” Jesus said to them, “Then I won’t tell you what authority I have to do these things.”

1.verse: A Story About God’s Son - Jesus began to use stories to teach the people. He said, “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it and dug a hole for a winepress and built a tower. Then he leased the land to some farmers and left for a trip.

2.verse: When it was time for the grapes to be picked, he sent a servant to the farmers to get his share of the grapes.

3.verse: But the farmers grabbed the servant and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

4.verse: Then the man sent another servant. They hit him on the head and showed no respect for him.

5.verse: So the man sent another servant, whom they killed. The man sent many other servants; the farmers beat some of them and killed others.

6.verse: “The man had one person left to send, his son whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

7.verse: “But the farmers said to each other, ‘This son will inherit the vineyard. If we kill him, it will be ours.’

8.verse: So they took the son, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.

9.verse: “So what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those farmers and will give the vineyard to other farmers.

10.verse: Surely you have read this Scripture: ‘The stone that the builders rejected became the cornerstone.

11.verse: The Lord did this, and it is wonderful to us.’” Psalm 118:22–23

12.verse: The Jewish leaders knew that the story was about them. So they wanted to find a way to arrest Jesus, but they were afraid of the people. So the leaders left him and went away.

13.verse: Is It Right to Pay Taxes or Not? - Later, the Jewish leaders sent some Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to trap him in saying something wrong.

14.verse: They came to him and said, “Teacher, we know that you are an honest man. You are not afraid of what other people think about you, because you pay no attention to who they are. And you teach the truth about God’s way. Tell us: Is it right to pay taxes to Caesar or not?

15.verse: Should we pay them, or not?” But knowing what these men were really trying to do, Jesus said to them, “Why are you trying to trap me? Bring me a coin to look at.”

16.verse: They gave Jesus a coin, and he asked, “Whose image and name are on the coin?” They answered, “Caesar’s.”

17.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and give to God the things that are God’s.” The men were amazed at what Jesus said.

18.verse: Some Sadducees Try to Trick Jesus - Then some Sadducees came to Jesus and asked him a question. (Sadducees believed that people would not rise from the dead.)

19.verse: They said, “Teacher, Moses wrote that if a man’s brother dies, leaving a wife but no children, then that man must marry the widow and have children for his brother.

20.verse: Once there were seven brothers. The first brother married and died, leaving no children.

21.verse: So the second brother married the widow, but he also died and had no children. The same thing happened with the third brother.

22.verse: All seven brothers married her and died, and none of the brothers had any children. Finally the woman died too.

23.verse: Since all seven brothers had married her, when people rise from the dead, whose wife will she be?”

24.verse: Jesus answered, “Why don’t you understand? Don’t you know what the Scriptures say, and don’t you know about the power of God?

25.verse: When people rise from the dead, they will not marry, nor will they be given to someone to marry. They will be like the angels in heaven.

26.verse: Surely you have read what God said about people rising from the dead. In the book in which Moses wrote about the burning bush, it says that God told Moses, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

27.verse: God is the God of the living, not the dead. You Sadducees are wrong!”

28.verse: The Most Important Command - One of the teachers of the law came and heard Jesus arguing with the Sadducees. Seeing that Jesus gave good answers to their questions, he asked Jesus, “Which of the commands is most important?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, “The most important command is this: ‘Listen, people of Israel! The Lord our God is the only Lord.

30.verse: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, all your soul, all your mind, and all your strength.’

31.verse: The second command is this: ‘Love your neighbor as you love yourself.’ There are no commands more important than these.”

32.verse: The man answered, “That was a good answer, Teacher. You were right when you said God is the only Lord and there is no other God besides him.

33.verse: One must love God with all his heart, all his mind, and all his strength. And one must love his neighbor as he loves himself. These commands are more important than all the animals and sacrifices we offer to God.”

34.verse: When Jesus saw that the man answered him wisely, Jesus said to him, “You are close to the kingdom of God.” And after that, no one was brave enough to ask Jesus any more questions.

35.verse: As Jesus was teaching in the Temple, he asked, “Why do the teachers of the law say that the Christ is the son of David?

36.verse: David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, said: ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by me at my right side, until I put your enemies under your control.”’ Psalm 110:1

37.verse: David himself calls the Christ ‘Lord,’ so how can the Christ be his son?” The large crowd listened to Jesus with pleasure.

38.verse: Jesus continued teaching and said, “Beware of the teachers of the law. They like to walk around wearing fancy clothes, and they love for people to greet them with respect in the marketplaces.

39.verse: They love to have the most important seats in the synagogues and at feasts.

40.verse: But they cheat widows and steal their houses and then try to make themselves look good by saying long prayers. They will receive a greater punishment.”

41.verse: True Giving - Jesus sat near the Temple money box and watched the people put in their money. Many rich people gave large sums of money.

42.verse: Then a poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which were only worth a few cents.

43.verse: Calling his followers to him, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow gave more than all those rich people.

44.verse: They gave only what they did not need. This woman is very poor, but she gave all she had; she gave all she had to live on.”

1.verse: The Temple Will Be Destroyed - As Jesus was leaving the Temple, one of his followers said to him, “Look, Teacher! How beautiful the buildings are! How big the stones are!”

2.verse: Jesus said, “Do you see all these great buildings? Not one stone will be left on another. Every stone will be thrown down to the ground.”

3.verse: Later, as Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives, opposite the Temple, he was alone with Peter, James, John, and Andrew. They asked Jesus,

4.verse: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are going to happen?”

5.verse: Jesus began to answer them, “Be careful that no one fools you.

6.verse: Many people will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the One,’ and they will fool many people.

7.verse: When you hear about wars and stories of wars that are coming, don’t be afraid. These things must happen before the end comes.

8.verse: Nations will fight against other nations, and kingdoms against other kingdoms. There will be earthquakes in different places, and there will be times when there is no food for people to eat. These things are like the first pains when something new is about to be born.

9.verse: “You must be careful. People will arrest you and take you to court and beat you in their synagogues. You will be forced to stand before kings and governors, to tell them about me. This will happen to you because you follow me.

10.verse: But before these things happen, the Good News must be told to all people.

11.verse: When you are arrested and judged, don’t worry ahead of time about what you should say. Say whatever is given you to say at that time, because it will not really be you speaking; it will be the Holy Spirit.

12.verse: “Brothers will give their own brothers to be killed, and fathers will give their own children to be killed. Children will fight against their own parents and cause them to be put to death.

13.verse: All people will hate you because you follow me, but those people who keep their faith until the end will be saved.

14.verse: “You will see ‘a blasphemous object that brings destruction’ standing where it should not be.” (You who read this should understand what it means.) “At that time, the people in Judea should run away to the mountains.

15.verse: If people are on the roofs of their houses, they must not go down or go inside to get anything out of their houses.

16.verse: If people are in the fields, they must not go back to get their coats.

17.verse: At that time, how terrible it will be for women who are pregnant or have nursing babies!

18.verse: Pray that these things will not happen in winter,

19.verse: because those days will be full of trouble. There will be more trouble than there has ever been since the beginning, when God made the world, until now, and nothing as bad will ever happen again.

20.verse: God has decided to make that terrible time short. Otherwise, no one would go on living. But God will make that time short to help the people he has chosen.

21.verse: At that time, someone might say to you, ‘Look, there is the Christ!’ Or another person might say, ‘There he is!’ But don’t believe them.

22.verse: False Christs and false prophets will come and perform great wonders and miracles. They will try to fool even the people God has chosen, if that is possible.

23.verse: So be careful. I have warned you about all this before it happens.

24.verse: “During the days after this trouble comes, ‘the sun will grow dark, and the moon will not give its light.

25.verse: The stars will fall from the sky. And the powers of the heavens will be shaken.’ Isaiah 13:10; 34:4

26.verse: “Then people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

27.verse: Then he will send his angels all around the earth to gather his chosen people from every part of the earth and from every part of heaven.

28.verse: “Learn a lesson from the fig tree: When its branches become green and soft and new leaves appear, you know summer is near.

29.verse: In the same way, when you see these things happening, you will know that the time is near, ready to come.

30.verse: I tell you the truth, all these things will happen while the people of this time are still living.

31.verse: Earth and sky will be destroyed, but the words I have said will never be destroyed.

32.verse: “No one knows when that day or time will be, not the angels in heaven, not even the Son. Only the Father knows.

33.verse: Be careful! Always be ready, because you don’t know when that time will be.

34.verse: It is like a man who goes on a trip. He leaves his house and lets his servants take care of it, giving each one a special job to do. The man tells the servant guarding the door always to be watchful.

35.verse: So always be ready, because you don’t know when the owner of the house will come back. It might be in the evening, or at midnight, or in the morning while it is still dark, or when the sun rises.

36.verse: Always be ready. Otherwise he might come back suddenly and find you sleeping.

37.verse: I tell you this, and I say this to everyone: ‘Be ready!’”

1.verse: The Plan to Kill Jesus - It was now only two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. The leading priests and teachers of the law were trying to find a trick to arrest Jesus and kill him.

2.verse: But they said, “We must not do it during the feast, because the people might cause a riot.”

3.verse: A Woman with Perfume for Jesus - Jesus was in Bethany at the house of Simon, who had a skin disease. While Jesus was eating there, a woman approached him with an alabaster jar filled with very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She opened the jar and poured the perfume on Jesus’ head.

4.verse: Some who were there became upset and said to each other, “Why waste that perfume?

5.verse: It was worth a full year’s work. It could have been sold and the money given to the poor.” And they got very angry with the woman.

6.verse: Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you troubling her? She did an excellent thing for me.

7.verse: You will always have the poor with you, and you can help them anytime you want. But you will not always have me.

8.verse: This woman did the only thing she could do for me; she poured perfume on my body to prepare me for burial.

9.verse: I tell you the truth, wherever the Good News is preached in all the world, what this woman has done will be told, and people will remember her.”

10.verse: Judas Becomes an Enemy of Jesus - One of the twelve apostles, Judas Iscariot, went to talk to the leading priests to offer to hand Jesus over to them.

11.verse: These priests were pleased about this and promised to pay Judas money. So he watched for the best time to turn Jesus in.

12.verse: Jesus Eats the Passover Meal - It was now the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread when the Passover lamb was sacrificed. Jesus’ followers said to him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”

13.verse: Jesus sent two of his followers and said to them, “Go into the city and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.

14.verse: When he goes into a house, tell the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says: “Where is my guest room in which I can eat the Passover meal with my followers?”’

15.verse: The owner will show you a large room upstairs that is furnished and ready. Prepare the food for us there.”

16.verse: So the followers left and went into the city. Everything happened as Jesus had said, so they prepared the Passover meal.

17.verse: In the evening, Jesus went to that house with the twelve.

18.verse: While they were all eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will turn against me—one of you eating with me now.”

19.verse: The followers were very sad to hear this. Each one began to say to Jesus, “I am not the one, am I?”

20.verse: Jesus answered, “It is one of the twelve—the one who dips his bread into the bowl with me.

21.verse: The Son of Man will die, just as the Scriptures say. But how terrible it will be for the person who hands the Son of Man over to be killed. It would be better for him if he had never been born.”

22.verse: The Lord’s Supper - While they were eating, Jesus took some bread and thanked God for it and broke it. Then he gave it to his followers and said, “Take it; this is my body.”

23.verse: Then Jesus took a cup and thanked God for it and gave it to the followers, and they all drank from the cup.

24.verse: Then Jesus said, “This is my blood which is the new agreement that God makes with his people. This blood is poured out for many.

25.verse: I tell you the truth, I will not drink of this fruit of the vine again until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

27.verse: Jesus’ Followers Will Leave Him - Then Jesus told the followers, “You will all stumble in your faith, because it is written in the Scriptures: ‘I will kill the shepherd, and the sheep will scatter.’ Zechariah 13:7

28.verse: But after I rise from the dead, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”

29.verse: Peter said, “Everyone else may stumble in their faith, but I will not.”

30.verse: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, tonight before the rooster crows twice you will say three times you don’t know me.”

31.verse: But Peter insisted, “I will never say that I don’t know you! I will even die with you!” And all the other followers said the same thing.

32.verse: Jesus Prays Alone - Jesus and his followers went to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Sit here while I pray.”

33.verse: Jesus took Peter, James, and John with him, and he began to be very sad and troubled.

34.verse: He said to them, “My heart is full of sorrow, to the point of death. Stay here and watch.”

35.verse: After walking a little farther away from them, Jesus fell to the ground and prayed that, if possible, he would not have this time of suffering.

36.verse: He prayed, “Abba, Father! You can do all things. Take away this cup of suffering. But do what you want, not what I want.”

37.verse: Then Jesus went back to his followers and found them asleep. He said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Couldn’t you stay awake with me for one hour?

38.verse: Stay awake and pray for strength against temptation. The spirit wants to do what is right, but the body is weak.”

39.verse: Again Jesus went away and prayed the same thing.

40.verse: Then he went back to his followers, and again he found them asleep, because their eyes were very heavy. And they did not know what to say to him.

41.verse: After Jesus prayed a third time, he went back to his followers and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? That’s enough. The time has come for the Son of Man to be handed over to sinful people.

42.verse: Get up, we must go. Look, here comes the man who has turned against me.”

43.verse: Jesus Is Arrested - At once, while Jesus was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve apostles, came up. With him were many people carrying swords and clubs who had been sent from the leading priests, the teachers of the law, and the Jewish elders.

44.verse: Judas had planned a signal for them, saying, “The man I kiss is Jesus. Arrest him and guard him while you lead him away.”

45.verse: So Judas went straight to Jesus and said, “Teacher!” and kissed him.

46.verse: Then the people grabbed Jesus and arrested him.

47.verse: One of his followers standing nearby pulled out his sword and struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.

48.verse: Then Jesus said, “You came to get me with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal.

49.verse: Every day I was with you teaching in the Temple, and you did not arrest me there. But all these things have happened to make the Scriptures come true.”

50.verse: Then all of Jesus’ followers left him and ran away.

51.verse: A young man, wearing only a linen cloth, was following Jesus, and the people also grabbed him.

52.verse: But the cloth he was wearing came off, and he ran away naked.

53.verse: Jesus Before the Leaders - The people who arrested Jesus led him to the house of the high priest, where all the leading priests, the elders, and the teachers of the law were gathered.

54.verse: Peter followed far behind and entered the courtyard of the high priest’s house. There he sat with the guards, warming himself by the fire.

55.verse: The leading priests and the whole Jewish council tried to find something that Jesus had done wrong so they could kill him. But the council could find no proof of anything.

56.verse: Many people came and told false things about him, but all said different things—none of them agreed.

57.verse: Then some people stood up and lied about Jesus, saying,

58.verse: “We heard this man say, ‘I will destroy this Temple that people made. And three days later, I will build another Temple not made by people.’”

59.verse: But even the things these people said did not agree.

60.verse: Then the high priest stood before them and asked Jesus, “Aren’t you going to answer? Don’t you have something to say about their charges against you?”

61.verse: But Jesus said nothing; he did not answer. The high priest asked Jesus another question: “Are you the Christ, the Son of the blessed God?”

62.verse: Jesus answered, “I am. And in the future you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of God, the Powerful One, and coming on clouds in the sky.”

63.verse: When the high priest heard this, he tore his clothes and said, “We don’t need any more witnesses!

64.verse: You all heard him say these things against God. What do you think?” They all said that Jesus was guilty and should die.
